org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.slip.utils

Class KLF200Response

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openhab.binding.velux.internal.bridge.slip.utils.KLF200Response

  • @NonNullByDefault
public class KLF200Response
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for handling of KLF200 response packets.

    Methods available:

    Static methods are:

    • introLogging(org.slf4j.Logger, short, byte[]) for logging used at the beginning of the response handling.
    • errorLogging(org.slf4j.Logger, short) for error logging during processing.
    • outroLogging(org.slf4j.Logger, boolean, boolean) logging used at the end of the response handling.
    • isLengthValid(org.slf4j.Logger, short, byte[], int) for validation of length of the data part of the message.
    • check4matchingNodeID(org.slf4j.Logger, int, int) for validation of node identifier.
    • check4matchingSessionID(org.slf4j.Logger, int, int) for validation of session identifier.
    Author:
    Guenther Schreiner - Initial contribution.

        public KLF200Response()

    • Method Detail

      • introLogging

        public static void introLogging(org.slf4j.Logger logger,
                                short responseCommand,
                                byte[] thisResponseData)
        Provides user-oriented logging in two log levels for monitoring KLF behavior.

        Introduction logging used at the beginning of the response handling.

        Parameters:
        logger - Instantiated logging class to be used for output.
        responseCommand - The command byte of the response packet.
        thisResponseData - The array of bytes which are passed back within the response package.

      • errorLogging

        public static void errorLogging(org.slf4j.Logger logger,
                                short responseCommand)
        Provides user-oriented logging in two log levels for monitoring KLF behavior.

        Error logging used at the point where an unexpected or unrecognized command has been received.

        Parameters:
        logger - Instantiated logging class to be used for output.
        responseCommand - The command byte of the response packet.

      • outroLogging

        public static void outroLogging(org.slf4j.Logger logger,
                                boolean success,
                                boolean finished)
        Provides user-oriented logging in two log levels for monitoring KLF behavior.

        Conclusion logging used at the end of the response handling.

        Parameters:
        logger - Instantiated logging class to be used for output.
        success - Describes the success of the response processing.
        finished - Describes whether the response processing has come to an end.

      • isLengthValid

        public static boolean isLengthValid(org.slf4j.Logger logger,
                                    short responseCommand,
                                    byte[] thisResponseData,
                                    int requiredResponseDataLength)
        Provides user-oriented logging in two log levels for monitoring KLF behavior.

        Check the intended length of the response packet.

        Parameters:
        logger - Instantiated logging class to be used for output.
        responseCommand - The command byte of the response packet.
        thisResponseData - The array of bytes which are passed back within the response package.
        requiredResponseDataLength - The expected size of the array of bytes which are passed back within the response package.
        Returns:
        isLengthValid of type boolean which signals the validity of the packet length.

      • check4matchingAnyID

        private static boolean check4matchingAnyID(org.slf4j.Logger logger,
                                           java.lang.String idName,
                                           int requestID,
                                           int responseID)
        Provides user-oriented logging in two log levels for monitoring KLF behavior.

        Internal support method to match two values for equality.

        Parameters:
        logger - Instantiated logging class to be used for output.
        idName - String describing the type of values being compared.
        requestID - Value of type int have been replaced within the request.
        responseID - Value of type int being received within the response.
        Returns:
        check4matchingAnyID of type boolean which signals the equality.

      • check4matchingNodeID

        public static boolean check4matchingNodeID(org.slf4j.Logger logger,
                                           int reqNodeID,
                                           int cfmNodeID)
        Compare the node identifier of the request with the node identifier within the response with user-oriented logging in two log levels for monitoring KLF behavior.
        Parameters:
        logger - Instantiated logging class to be used for output.
        reqNodeID - Node identifier of the request.
        cfmNodeID - Node identifier of the response.
        Returns:
        success of type boolean which signals the success of the communication.

      • check4matchingSessionID

        public static boolean check4matchingSessionID(org.slf4j.Logger logger,
                                              int reqSessionID,
                                              int cfmSessionID)
        Compare the session identifier of the request with the session identifier within the response with user-oriented logging in two log levels for monitoring KLF behavior.
        Parameters:
        logger - Instantiated logging class to be used for output.
        reqSessionID - Session identifier of the request.
        cfmSessionID - Session identifier of the response.
        Returns:
        success of type boolean which signals the success of the communication.
